tool_description: Integrated payments designed for platforms. With scale of JPMorgan Chase.
name: WePay
title: WePay

api_list.name: findAccount
api_list.description: Use this call to search the accounts of the user associated with the access token used to make the call. You can search by ``name`` or ``reference_id``, and the response will be an array of all the matching accounts. If both ``name`` and ``reference_id`` are blank, this will return an array of all of the user’s accounts. Each element of the array in the response will include the same data as returned from the ``/account `` call.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://wepay2.p.rapidapi.com/account/find"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "wepay2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: account
api_list.description: Use this call to lookup the details of a payment account on WePay. The payment account must belong to the user associated with the access token used to make the call.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://wepay2.p.rapidapi.com/account"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "wepay2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: createAccount
api_list.description: Use this call to create a new payment account for the user associated with the access token used to make this call. This call returns the same response as the ``/account`` call.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://wepay2.p.rapidapi.com/account/create"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "wepay2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
